00066 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC
00067 #define sched_malloc(size)              rt_malloc((size))
00068 #define sched_free(adr)                 rt_free((adr))
00069 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN
00070 #define sched_mem_init()
00071 #define sched_mem_end()
00072 #else  /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00073 #define sched_mem_init() \
00074         { if(__rtai_heap_init() != 0) { \
00075                 return(-ENOMEM); \
00076         } }
00077 #define sched_mem_end()         __rtai_heap_exit()
00078 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00079 #define call_exit_handlers(task)                __call_exit_handlers(task)
00080 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2) __set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00081 #else  /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */
00082 #define sched_malloc(size)      kmalloc((size), GFP_KERNEL)
00083 #define sched_free(adr)         kfree((adr))
00084 #define sched_mem_init()
00085 #define sched_mem_end()
00086 #define call_exit_handlers(task)
00087 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00088 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */

00116 #define rt_time_h (rt_smp_time_h[cpuid & sqilter])
00117 #define oneshot_timer (rt_smp_oneshot_timer[cpuid & sqilter])
00118 #define rt_linux_task (rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid])

00127 extern unsigned long sqilter;
00128 
00129 static inline void send_sched_ipi(unsigned long dest)
00130 {
00131         unsigned long flags;
00132         rtai_hw_lock(flags);
00133         _send_sched_ipi(dest);
00134         rtai_hw_unlock(flags);
00135 }
00136 
00137 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap) \
00138 do { \
00139         if (sqilter) { \
00140                 if (schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00141         } else { \
00142                 rt_schedule(); \
00143         } \
00144 } while (0)
00145 
00146 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap) \
00147 do { \
00148         if (sqilter && schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00149         rt_schedule(); \
00150 } while (0)
00151 
00152 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid) \
00153         do { \
00154                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00155                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00156                 } else { \
00157                         rt_schedule(); \
00158                 } \
00159         } while (0)
00160 
00161 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid) \
00162         { \
00163                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00164                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00165                 } \
00166                 rt_schedule(); \
00167         }
00168 
00169 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00170 
00171 #define send_sched_ipi(dest)
00172 
00173 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap)  rt_schedule()
00174 
00175 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap)       rt_schedule()
00176 
00177 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid)        rt_schedule()
00178 
00179 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid)   rt_schedule()
00180 
00181 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00183 #define BASE_SOFT_PRIORITY 1000000000
00184 
00185 #define TASK_HARDREALTIME  TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE
00186 
00187 static inline void enq_ready_edf_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00188 {
00189         RT_TASK *task;
00190 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00191         task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00192 #else
00193         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00194 #endif
00195         while (task->policy < 0 && ready_task->period >= task->period) {
00196                 task = task->rnext;
00197         }
00198         task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00199         ready_task->rnext = task;
00200 }
00201 
00202 #define MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ (2 << 6)
00203 
00204 struct klist_t { volatile int srq, in, out; void *task[MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ]; };
00205 extern struct klist_t wake_up_srq;
00206 
00207 static inline void enq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00208 {
00209         RT_TASK *task;
00210         if (ready_task->is_hard) {
00211 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00212                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00213 #else
00214                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00215 #endif
00216                 while (ready_task->priority >= task->priority) {
00217                         if ((task = task->rnext)->priority < 0) break;
00218                 }
00219                 task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00220                 ready_task->rnext = task;
00221         } else {
00222                 ready_task->state |= RT_SCHED_SFTRDY;
00223                 wake_up_srq.task[wake_up_srq.in] = ready_task->lnxtsk;
00224                 wake_up_srq.in = (wake_up_srq.in + 1) & (MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ - 1);
00225                 rt_pend_linux_srq(wake_up_srq.srq);
00226         }
00227 }
00228 
00229 static inline int renq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task, int priority)
00230 {
00231         int retval;
00232         if ((retval = ready_task->priority != priority)) {
00233                 ready_task->priority = priority;
00234                 if (ready_task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00235                         (ready_task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task->rnext;
00236                         (ready_task->rnext)->rprev = ready_task->rprev;
00237                         enq_ready_task(ready_task);
00238                 }
00239         }
00240         return retval;
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline int renq_current(RT_TASK *rt_current, int priority)
00244 {
00245         int retval;
00246         if ((retval = rt_current->priority != priority)) {
00247                 rt_current->priority = priority;
00248                 (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00249                 (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00250                 enq_ready_task(rt_current);
00251         }
00252         return retval;
00253 }
00254 
00255 static inline void rem_ready_task(RT_TASK *task)
00256 {
00257         if (task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00258                 if (!task->is_hard) {
00259                         (task->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00260                 }
00261                 (task->rprev)->rnext = task->rnext;
00262                 (task->rnext)->rprev = task->rprev;
00263         }
00264 }
00265 
00266 static inline void rem_ready_current(RT_TASK *rt_current)
00267 {
00268         if (!rt_current->is_hard) {
00269                 (rt_current->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00270         }
00271         (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00272         (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00273 }
00274 
00275 static inline void enq_timed_task(RT_TASK *timed_task)
00276 {
00277         RT_TASK *task;
00278 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00279         task = rt_smp_linux_task[timed_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].tnext;
00280 #else
00281         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00282 #endif
00283         while (timed_task->resume_time > task->resume_time) {
00284                 task = task->tnext;
00285         }
00286         task->tprev = (timed_task->tprev = task->tprev)->tnext = timed_task;
00287         timed_task->tnext = task;
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline void wake_up_timed_tasks(int cpuid)
00291 {
00292         RT_TASK *task;
00293 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00294         task = rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid = cpuid & sqilter].tnext;
00295 #else
00296         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00297 #endif
00298         while (task->resume_time <= rt_time_h) {
00299                 if ((task->state &= ~(RT_SCHED_DELAYED | RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE | RT_SCHED_RECEIVE | RT_SCHED_SEND | RT_SCHED_RPC | RT_SCHED_RETURN | RT_SCHED_MBXSUSP)) == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00300                         if (task->policy < 0) {
00301                                 enq_ready_edf_task(task);
00302                         } else {
00303                                 enq_ready_task(task);
00304                         }
00305                 }
00306                 task = task->tnext;
00307         }
00308 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00309         rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid].tnext = task;
00310         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid];
00311 #else
00312         rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext = task;
00313         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[0];
00314 #endif
00315 }
00316 
00317 static inline void rem_timed_task(RT_TASK *task)
00318 {
00319         if ((task->state & RT_SCHED_DELAYED)) {
00320                 (task->tprev)->tnext = task->tnext;
00321                 (task->tnext)->tprev = task->tprev;
00322         }
00323 }

00325 #define get_time() rt_get_time()
00326 #if 0
00327 static inline RTIME get_time(void)
00328 {
00329 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00330         if (sqilter) {
00331                 int cpuid;
00332                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[cpuid = hard_cpu_id()] ? rdtsc() : rt_smp_times[cpuid].tick_time;
00333         } else {
00334                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[0] ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00335         }
00336 #else
00337         return oneshot_timer ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00338 #endif
00339 }
00340 #endif
00341 
00342 static inline void enqueue_blocked(RT_TASK *task, QUEUE *queue, int qtype)
00343 {
00344         QUEUE *q;
00345         task->blocked_on = (q = queue);
00346         if (!qtype) {
00347                 while ((q = q->next) != queue && (q->task)->priority <= task->priority);
00348         }
00349         q->prev = (task->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(task->queue);
00350         task->queue.next = q;
00351 }
00352 
00353 
00354 static inline void dequeue_blocked(RT_TASK *task)
00355 {
00356         task->prio_passed_to     = NOTHING;
00357         (task->queue.prev)->next = task->queue.next;
00358         (task->queue.next)->prev = task->queue.prev;
00359         task->blocked_on         = NOTHING;
00360 }
00361 
00362 static __volatile__ inline unsigned long pass_prio(RT_TASK *to, RT_TASK *from)
00363 {
00364         QUEUE *q;
00365 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00366         unsigned long schedmap;
00367         schedmap = 0;
00368 #endif
00369         from->prio_passed_to = to;
00370         while (to && to->priority > from->priority) {
00371                 to->priority = from->priority;
00372                 if (to->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00373                         (to->rprev)->rnext = to->rnext;
00374                         (to->rnext)->rprev = to->rprev;
00375                         enq_ready_task(to);
00376 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00377                         set_bit(to->runnable_on_cpus & 0x1F, &schedmap);
00378 #endif
00379                 } else if ((q = to->blocked_on) && !((to->state & RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE) &&
00380  ((SEM *)q)->qtype)) {
00381                         (to->queue.prev)->next = to->queue.next;
00382                         (to->queue.next)->prev = to->queue.prev;
00383                         while ((q = q->next) != to->blocked_on && (q->task)->priority <= to->priority);
00384                         q->prev = (to->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(to->queue);
00385                         to->queue.next = q;
00386                 }
00387                 to = to->prio_passed_to;
00388         }
00389 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00390         return schedmap;
00391 #else
00392         return 0;
00393 #endif
00394 }

00396 static inline RT_TASK *_rt_whoami(void)
00397 {
00398 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00399         RT_TASK *rt_current;
00400         unsigned long flags;
00401         flags = rt_global_save_flags_and_cli();
00402         rt_current = RT_CURRENT;
00403         rt_global_restore_flags(flags);
00404         return rt_current;
00405 #else
00406         return rt_smp_current[0];
00407 #endif
00408 }
00409 
00410 static inline void __call_exit_handlers(RT_TASK *task)
00411 {
00412         XHDL *pt, *tmp;
00413 
00414         pt = task->ExitHook; // Initialise ExitHook in rt_task_init()
00415         while ( pt ) {
00416                 (*pt->fun) (pt->arg1, pt->arg2);
00417                 tmp = pt;
00418                 pt  = pt->nxt;
00419                 rt_free(tmp);
00420         }
00421         task->ExitHook = 0;
00422 }
00423 
00424 static inline XHDL *__set_exit_handler(RT_TASK *task, void (*fun) (void *, int), void *arg1, int arg2)
00425 {
00426         XHDL *p;
00427 
00428         // exit handler functions are automatically executed at terminattion time by rt_task_delete()
00429         // in the reverse order they were created (like C++ destructors behave).
00430         if (task->magic != RT_TASK_MAGIC) return 0;
00431         if (!(p = (XHDL *) rt_malloc (sizeof(XHDL)))) return 0;
00432         p->fun  = fun;
00433         p->arg1 = arg1;
00434         p->arg2 = arg2;
00435         p->nxt  = task->ExitHook;
00436         return (task->ExitHook = p);
00437 }
